, holotype NHMUK 1857.6.4.1549, Mazatlan.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. In addition to the type material the following lots were examined. NHMLAC:
LACM 1977 - 144.14 , Chame Point , Panama Bay , Panama Prov. , Panama , 4 sh
;
LACM 1984 - 45.11 , between Seymour Island and Baltra Island , Galapagos Islands ,
30–46 m
, 4 sh
;
LACM 1980 - 65.13 , Salango Island , Manabi , Ecuador ,
6–12 m
, 5 sh
;
LACM 1934 - 288.3 , Tagus Cove , Albemarle Island , Galapagos Islands , 3 sh
;
LACM 1933 - 163.4 , Albemarle Point , Albemarle Island , Galapagos Islands ,
26 m
, 2 sh
;
LACM 1984 - 46.10 , Plazas Island , E of Santa Cruz Island , Galapagos Islands ,
21–30 m
, 1 sh
;
LACM 1934 - 268.2 , South Seymour Island , Galapagos Islands ,
30 m
, 1 sh
;
LACM 1934 - 273.10 , James Bay , James Island , Galapagos Islands ,
44 m
, 3 sh
.
SBMNH :

3–20 m
, 2 sh
;

6–15 m
, 3 sh
;

;

;

Original diagnosis. “ C. (
Fartulum
) t. juniore ‘
C. dextroverso
’ simili, sed septo subconvexo, mucrone reversa, semi-cylindracea, arcuata, aperturam versus convexa; dorsum versus convexa t. adulta?….; operculo?” Carpenter (1857: 329) .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 42.
Caecum reversum
. A . Profile view with periostracum (LACM 1977-144.14). B . Profile view without periostracum (LACM 1977-144.14). C–D . Ventral views depicting mucro variations (SBMNH 452450). E . Holotype, NHMUK 1857.6.4.1549. F . Operculum, exterior surface (LACM 1977-144.14).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution and Habitat. From Navidad Bar, Jalisco , Mexico to Manabi , Ecuador , including the Galapagos Islands . Intertidal to
54 m .
Common subtidally on sand and rubble substrates.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 43.
Caecum reversum
shells at different growth stages. A . Teleoconchs II to IV (LACM 1977-144.14). B . Teleoconch III (SBMNH 620176). C . Surface of teleoconchs II and III (SBMNH 620176). D . Teleoconchs III to V (SBMNH 620176). E . Teleoconch V (SBMNH 452450). F . Teleoconch VI (SBMNH 452450). G . Teleoconch VI (SBMNH 452450). H . Surface of teleoconchs IV to VI (SBMNH 452450).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Although Carpenter (1857) named
Caecum reversum
based on the mucro of the holotype curving backward, this is not always the case (NHMUK 1857.6.4.1549, Fig. 42E ). The mucro of
C. reversum
may also be wavy or folded to one side ( Figs. 42 C–D), and the position of the mucro can change with each subsequent growth stage ( Figs. 43 A–B, D–G).
